intro: Sanchezia rhodochroa, commonly known as the red-stemmed stinging nettle, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its hairy, opposite leaves and a distinctive red stem that becomes more prominent as the plant matures. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Sanchezia rhodochroa is also noted for its ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments.
